44 /** Set the underlying cuda device poiner for a buffer. The device
45  * pointer should be allocated using cuMemAlloc or similar and must
46  * have an extent large enough to cover that specified by the
47  * halide_buffer_t extent fields. The dev field of the halide_buffer_t
48  * must be NULL when this routine is called. This call can fail due to
49  * being passed an invalid device pointer. The device and host dirty
50  * bits are left unmodified. */
51 extern int halide_cuda_wrap_device_ptr(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf, uint64_t device_ptr);
52 
53 /** Disconnect this halide_buffer_t from the device pointer it was
54  * previously wrapped around. Should only be called for a
55  * halide_buffer_t that halide_cuda_wrap_device_ptr was previously
56  * called on. The device field of the halide_buffer_t will be NULL on
57  * return.
58  */
59 extern int halide_cuda_detach_device_ptr(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
60 
61 /** Return the underlying device pointer for a halide_buffer_t. This buffer
62  * must be valid on a Cuda device, or not have any associated device
63  * memory. If there is no device memory (dev field is NULL), this
64  * returns 0.
65  */
66 extern uintptr_t halide_cuda_get_device_ptr(void *user_context, struct halide_buffer_t *buf);
67 
68 /** Release any currently-unused device allocations back to the cuda
69  * driver. See halide_reuse_device_allocations. */
70 extern int halide_cuda_release_unused_device_allocations(void *user_context);
71

HalideRuntime.h
This file declares the routines used by Halide internally in its runtime.
